info.name: Ed-Fi ODS/API Integration Test Suite Multiple Edorg types
info.description: Localhost integration testing using Postman Scripts

request.description:
This api post method adds new academicWeeks for particular school .
This test method will throw WeekIdentifier is required error when WeekIdentifier is not passed

item.name: Scenario 8  Cannot Create a StudentProgramAssociation for either associated EdOrgId ( CommunityProviderId and PostSecondaryInstitutionId)

exec: pm.test("Should match with Error Message Response ", () => {

pm.expect(responseItems.message).to.equal("Authorization denied.  The claims associated with an identifier of 'PostSecondaryInstitutionId' cannot be used to authorize a request associated with an identifier of 'SchoolId'. Authorization denied.  The claims associated with an identifier of 'CommunityProviderId' cannot be used to authorize a request associated with an identifier of 'SchoolId'.");

item.name: Scenario 9 GET request for StudentProgramAssociations should return all 3 records (SchoolId, a CommunityProviderId, and a PostSecondaryInstitutionId)

item.description:
Ensure that resources with EdOrg Id are accessible for each associated EdOrg type
Configure an API client with a SchoolId, a CommunityProviderId, and a PostSecondaryInstitutionId.

Create StudentProgramAssociations for each with an associated Student (through the School). (NOTE: Suggest creating a new School, Student and StudentSchoolAssociation for this scenario)

GET request for StudentProgramAssociations should return all 3 records just created.
GET request for StudentProgramAssociations should not return any pre-existing records for other EdOrgs.
Ensure that resources with concrete EdOrg Ids are accessible
GET request for StudentSchoolAssociations should return the associated Student.

item.name: Scenario 10  GET request to CommunityProviderLicenses should not generate an error

exec: pm.test("Should return some data for verification", () => {
pm.test("Should return only associated communityProvider in CommunityProviderLicenses Response ", () => {

item.description:
Configure an API client with a CommunityProviderId and PostSecondaryInstitutionId.

GET request to CommunityProviderLicenses should not generate an error.

item.name: Scenario 11  GET request to StudentDisciplineIncidentAssociations should return 403 indicating there's no way to authorize the request

exec: pm.test("Should match with Error Message Response ", () => {

pm.expect(responseItems.message).to.equal("Unable to authorize the request because there is no authorization support for associating the API client's associated claim values (of 'CommunityProviderId', 'PostSecondaryInstitutionId') with the requested resource ('StudentDisciplineIncidentAssociation').");

item.description:
Configure an API client with a CommunityProviderId and PostSecondaryInstitutionId.
GET request to StudentDisciplineIncidentAssociations should return 403 indicating there's no way to authorize the request (exact message TBD).
